Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; below, single white band; exterior: narrow band on top of rim; below, sphinx (face, chest and part of wing with red remaining) to right; pendant triangle, dot, elaborate rosette and short vertical strokes as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0636) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
